title: Thresh vs Blitzcrank
body: I like pulling supports because they can be extremely rewarding when you land a pull. I'm just conflicted with which one I want, Thresh or Blitz. Could someone explain to me how significant their playstyles differentiate, they both seem to be, 'CC the enemy as much as possible when you land that pull'.

replies.body:
Both Thresh and Blitzcrank have been my 2 mains for the past few years, so I like to think I'm at least a little qualified here :D

**_Essentially the big difference is that Thresh is more versatile._**

+ Thresh's playstyle doesn't just revolve around hitting his hook, you can also make things happen with flay or make a play with lantern. He can also transition into a complete peel support extremely well if needed.



+ Blitzcrank probably has better playmaking than Thresh, but he's super binary. You either hit the hook, or you don't. There's not many other options past that.

 His peel is also quite average late game, especially if you need to peel more than 1 person off the ADC.

Thresh is also harder to play and has better defensive peel but less options to kill an opponent once grabbed. Blitz has higher burst damage and starts the game just a little more durable than thresh does.

a third contender enters the mix? {{champion:111}} {{champion:111}} 

Blitz is great for all out offense i mean he can miss nearly all his hooks and get 1 q+e combo at the right range and it can be fatal for an adc/supp early on.
His ult is aoe silence which is great for teamfights and has a really low cd.

Thresh is better imo as he has much better utility. he has q which will hook an enemy in which you can pull yourself to them. he has a great passive gaining ap+armour for souls collected, his flay passive is great for harrassment/ farming stacks on relic (hes classed as ranged so its hard to get the execute without using flay right), flay is great for displacing enemies and combos well with q, His W is just awesome and is a great safety net.(assuming the person know how to use it kek). his ult is great in all aspects.

have you considered? {{champion:111}}  hes also very good

Blitz is all about his hook since its brings enemies to you. He can hook and pull you under tower, through a wall and late game if you hook an ADC you can win the game single handedly. Tha being said, if you hook in a Leona or something, you can also single handedly lose the game.
Blitz is VERY simple, Q+E+R. Repeat. You can also do things like W and run at the enemy to E first then Q so you dont miss. But he is very 1 track style of play.

Thresh provides a lot more than just a hook. His Flay is useful for cancelling many other champion abilities and his lantern is probably one of the most useful abilities in the game.
Thresh is useful when ahead as a playmaker and when behind as a life saver. He provides a lot more utility to the team however he requires follow up.

You can hook, take the hook and try to lantern your teammate, but if they dont want to follow up because "its a bad idea", you're screwed.
Blitz on the other hand, hooking someone forces fights immediately (for better or worse).

Its a lot easier to be a good Blitz than a good Thresh.
